p: Despite the paucity of firm data on direct myocardial involvement in COVID-19 patients, there are ample data on secondary involvement of the cardiovascular system, manifesting as elevated blood levels of cardiac enzymes; such as cardiac troponin I and B-type natriuretic peptide, regional and global wall motion abnormalities, cardiac arrhythmias, intravascular thrombosis, and heart failure (reviewed in [ 33, 34, 35]). More importantly, concomitant cardiovascular disease and secondary cardiac involvement are major determinants of clinical outcomes, including mortality in patients with COVID-19 [ 36, 37].
